title: Bolonewt hits Paris!
content:
User Dominique Massot sent a storefront photo and flyer for the new shop OLIVARI at 8 rue Littré, 75006 Paris France, featuring one of my old free fonts: [Bolonewt](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253/http:/www.1001fonts.com/font_details.html?font_id=2585)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253im_/http:/typophile.com/files/facade_small_4419.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253im_/http:/typophile.com/files/flyer_verso_4616.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253im_/http:/typophile.com/files/flyer_recto_6611.jpg)

It works wonderfully on this shop sign, but Bolonewt is a font I made many years ago, and as proud as I was of it then, knowing what I've learned since then makes me think it looks like ass.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bolonewt2585_5196.big.png)

The curves don't blend into the straights right, and the "s" is frightening! So, I'm determined to fix it somehow.
author: cuttlefish

comments.content: Congratulations. Go and visit [**Olivari's site**](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253/http:/www.olivari.fr/). The store looks really nice and in the [panorama](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253/http:/www.olivari.fr/pano.html), you can see your font on the back wall, above the shelves.

Sadly it appears Olivari's website is gone. I have no idea whether it's still in business, but five years is a long time for a small retailer, and many fail much more quickly than that.

I wish I'd been able to get a screenshot of the interior panorama while I had the chance.

You can still find your font on the site of the designer that had made Olivari's site: [http://www.dominiquemassot.fr/index.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253/http:/www.dominiquemassot.fr/index.php "http://www.dominiquemassot.fr/index.php"). There is a copy of Olivari's site at the url [http://www.dominiquemassot.fr/olivari\_old/galerie.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20140726025253/http:/www.dominiquemassot.fr/olivari_old/galerie.php "http://www.dominiquemassot.fr/olivari\_old/galerie.php") (the shop closed in 2011). You can still make a virtual visit inside the shop.
